body.p: Kentucky state and U.S. Representative. Studied law in Virginia. Admitted to the bar in Versailles, Kentucky in 1828. Moved to Louisville in 1833. Elected to the State House of Representatives from 1832 to 1836, and 1838 to 1839. Elected to U.S. Congress from 1841 to 1843. Served in the Mexican-American War as a captain of a volunteer cavalry regiment for one year. Afterwards returned to Kentucky and was elected to the Kentucky House from 1854-1856. After his term moved to Chicago temporarily. Soon returned to Kentucky and practiced law through the duration of the war. Died on September 22, 1864.
